summary: The document comprises records from the Assassination Records Review Board, focusing on the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff payroll records. It details notifications about document status, reasons for postponements, and specifics of payroll authorizations for Beverly A. Smith, a Clerk Typist. The records also include memoranda about her employment and the payroll certification requirements for committee staff, highlighting the bureaucratic processes and privacy concerns in historical records.
key_findings: Postponement of parts of the document was due to the inclusion of Social Security numbers, considered an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.
Beverly A. Smith was initially employed as a Clerk Typist with a starting salary of $11,500.00, which was later adjusted.
The document underscores the bureaucratic intricacies of payroll authorization and the significance of privacy protections in historical documents.
It illustrates the ongoing historical interest in the JFK assassination and provides insight into the administrative workings of the HSCA.
